description.narrative: By 2021, the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security and other lines ministries have enhanced capacity to effectively implement and monitor the provision of child-sensitive social protection for children (e.g. child support grant, disability grant, grant for poor students and others)

mailing-address.narrative: 19 Phra Athit Road Banglumpoo Pranakorn Bangkok 10200

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2021, the Ministry of Social Development and Human Security and other lines ministries have enhanced capacity to effectively implement and monitor the provision of child-sensitive social protection for children (e.g. child support grant, disability grant, grant for poor students and others)

description.narrative: UNICEF successfully engaged in evidence-based advocacy, including documentation and sharing of good practice at the school and local education authority level to address barriers faced by migrant children; and provided implementation support to enrol 1300 migrant children in public schools in two provinces. Additionally, results and recommendations from the pilot on mother-tongue based education shared in multiple fora and informed the design of an engagement strategy to reach 1000 schools in southern provinces in 2020. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:31/12/2019

title.narrative: Number of children affected by migration who accessed basic education services supported by UNICEF in the previous academic year.

Advocacy indicator placeholder: Extent of advocacy progress towards ensuring that budget is allocated in the 3 southernmost provinces for systematic roll out of mother-tongue based education in public schools Level 1: Convening stakeholders from 3 southernmost provinces reviewing of the scale up plan Level 2: High executives
Number of children reached with pre-primary, primary and secondary online/distance education lesson with UNICEF support in the reporting year [COVID]

Extent to which secondary school drop-out is addressed Level 1: The causes of secondary school drop-out are analysed (study conducted by UNICEF) Level 2: The reasons behind secondary school drop-out are discussed with MOE (policy dialogue) Level 3: MOE has developed strategies to address the reasons behind secondary school drop-out
